intro: Seychelles is a growing economy with a very favourable climate for the establishment of companies. The law governing the creation of corporations in this jurisdiction, known as the “International Business Company Act”, came into force in 1994, with recent amendments made up to 2013.
The legislation is modern and useful for multiple uses, inspired by the best in the market.

Seychelles is a member of the African Union and actively cooperates with the OECD in international tax transparency matters, having signed double taxation treaties and tax information exchange treaties with more than 25 countries around the world.
highlights: No taxes levied on offshore and banking transactions.
social: Location: Indian Ocean, 240 miles east of Kenya.
Area: Over 100 islands comprising 284 square miles. One third of the population lives in Mahe, the capital.
Official Language: Selsewa, but English is the official language for international business
Government: Constitutional Democracy. Commonwealth of Nations Member.
Legal Tender: Seychelles Rupee, with an exchange rate of approximately SR5.00 per US Dollar.
Industry: Tourism, financial services and small industries
